title: How much is a first edition alcoholics anonymous book worth? - Quora

response.answer_text: A First Edition print of Alcoholics Anonymous “Big Book”, in mint condition can be worth as much as any collector is willing to pay. I've heard of pristine condition prints selling for as much as $5,000.00. It's really a LOT like The Holy Bible. To another recovering alcoholic, who is “devout” in their recovery program and the 12-Steps, it's worth far more than it would be to a non-alcoholic…just as a very old 1st edition print of The Holy Bible would be worth thousands to tens of thousands to another Christian, but an atheist would pay more for a copy of Rolling Stone magazine. Lol. Everything's relative.

There are many variables in valuing any book. A copy of the The Alcoholics Anonymous Big Book first edition and first printing, is worth at least $15,000 to $20,000 or more depending on: ConditionPresence/absence of dust jacketProvenance (was it owned/signed by a prominent AA figure)You can see one for sale here on ABE Books for $25,000. As soon as you get into second printing, third printing, etc., as well as second and third edition, the prices fall of quite rapidly. Here, for example, is a first edition, 16th printing in fine shape for $299 on eBay.
